messages.title: Getting to know Ryan
messages.content: Ryan shares information about his personal background, academic history, and work experience.

messages.title: Britain needs a real opposition to dangerous Brexit
messages.content: The message emphasizes the need for a strong opposition to the Brexit strategy proposed by Conservatives, likening them to UKIP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ryan is determined to keep Britain as close to the European Union as possible, including within the Single Market and Customs Union.
Improving transport links on bus routes, South West trains and the District Line.
Working with local businesses to improve working sites and save our high streets.
Opposing Putney High Street's air pollution.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Putney boasted the second highest Remain vote in the EU referendum, rendering it at risk of a Lib Dem win.

issues.brexitEurope: Ryan will fight for Britain to remain as close to the EU as possible, including withing the Single Market and Customs Union. Britain needs a strong opposition to a dangerous Brexit. The Lib Dems are fighting to get the best deal for Britain.
issues.environment: Opposing a 3rd runway at Heathrow. Opposing Putney High Street's Air pollution.

leaflet.personalStatement: I grew up living around the UK as my Dad was an RAF Fireman... I currently work for a charity on improving Science Education in schools.

politicalExperience.role: National Policy Officer for the Liberal Democrats
politicalExperience.achievements: Used expertise to contribute to the manifesto, health, housing and higher education.

quotes.text: Theresa May says she will take the UK into the hardest of Brexits.
I can hardly believe that the PM is now using the phrases and words that I've been mocked for using for years.
Lib Dems are the anti-Brexit, Remain Scientific alliance outside of the vortex of UK politics.

images.caption: Ryan pictured with supporters and promoting his stance on remaining close to the European Union.
Images depicting Theresa May and Donald Trump, Theresa May with Nigel Farage, and Nigel Farage alone, with quotes emphasizing the danger of their hard Brexit views.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet articulates a clear differentiation between the Conservatives and UKIP, positioning the Liberal Democrats as the party advocating for Britain's close ties with the EU.
